Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay before you fly”
Reviews.Author: czechmate1ca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here March 12, 2012. We arrived around 9:00pm and was happy that the restaurant in the hotel was open til 10:00pm. We had a great dinner and our waiter (Josh I think) was excellent. Our room was fabulous. We were on the top floor overlooking the waterfront. We were flying on Porter Airlines from Toronto Island the next day. We left our vehicle there for 6 days and it was only a $8.00 cab ride to the airport. We will definitely stay there again! They also have a great gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: SLMPLS
Reviews.Content: A great 2 night stay at the Radisson Admiral. The view from the room rivals any "great view" anywhere! The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and even the lunch served at my on site meeting was great. Once you look around a bit, you'll notice the hotel is undergoing a transformation and the parts that have been renovated such as the public bathrooms and the restaurant are beautiful suggesting great things are ahead for the admiral. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone heading to Toronto for work or play.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Morgan W
Reviews.Content: We were heading to a Leaf game and it was about a 20 minute walk to the Air Canada Centre, which is what we were looking for. There was lots of parking and the staff was nice. We got a room with 2 beds. Two of us shared one bed, and one in the other. Only complaint was that the mattresses felt really hard so we didn't have the best sleep, but all of us are used to pillow-top, softer matresses, so maybe we just noticed the difference more. The room was clean and modern. We had breakfast at the Williams in the Pet Discovery Centre beside the hotel. It was good. Had we stayed longer, we probably would have explored that builiding. Overall, we were just looking for a clean place to stay that had parking, was reasonably priced for downtown and close to the ACC. This hotel had all that and we were not dissappointed. Would stay there again if we needed a place downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice views”
Reviews.Author: KatCanuck
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights end of January. Beautiful views overlooking Lake Ontario, can see the planes coming in to the Island airport. Easy walk to Queen's Quay, Harbourfront, Convention Centre, Rogers Centre, CN Tower. Also AC Centre, Via Train Station, Young St/Eaton Centre walking distance (maybe 30min to Eaton?). There is a nice skating rink by the water and boardwalk maybe a block east from the hotel, can see it from the rooms that are facing that direction. Rooms aren't huge but not small either, beds are good, not luxury but everything clean and comfortable. The staff at the front desk were quite pleasant also.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of Lake Ontario!”
Reviews.Author: BrendanC_4
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting at the Radisson Admiral so I stayed one night. I was given a room facing Lake Ontario, which was outstanding. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. The bed was amazing. Service at the hotel was professional. In the morning, I had breakfast at the hotel, which was also very good. The meeting was in the hotel, which was very convenient. We had lunch and the food was great. I was given a late checkout with no hassles. Overall, I had an excellent stay at the Radisson Admiral. If you choose this hotel on your next visit to Toronto you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Vissidarte
Reviews.Content: Toronto is a wonderful city, and we were returning on a budget. As Club carlson members, we got a great deal using points. Still we were welcomed warmly and allowed an early check-in on a Saturday. We liked the room, ours faced the side street and had a sliver of a harbor view. We did not have noise problems, but were not on the main street (Queen's Quay).We walked over to the famous (and free) Yo Yo Ma garden. Were able to hop a streetcar and connect to their subway for everything we needed. Be forewarned- parking is NOT included. We paid $15/day on a weekend. Still, this is a great place to stay for a quick tourist visit.

Reviews.Title: “Never again. Street cars buzz rooms til very later at night. Poor service from front desk”
Reviews.Author: Tony T
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 212 facing Queens Quay where street cars pass by often until well after midnight and get started again very early in morning. Not only are they loud but the vibration buzzes your room. I finally asked to be changed rooms. Front desk then moves me to rm 624. After packing up my stuff and lugging to new rooom (no help was offered or given), the first thing I hear when i step into the room is another street car. I open curtains and they've given me a room cornering on Queens Quay...same issue with sound. I called down to front desk and was told there was nothing they could do. Only 2 rms per floor on backside of bldg and they were taken. Front desk was insincere and completely uncaring. I will never recommend this hotel to anyone. Horrible experience. Hotel is old and not well maintained as well.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room”
Reviews.Author: travelme79
Reviews.Content: I must say the rooms here are top notch. I spend 6 months on the road a year and this hotel made it a enjoyable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and a clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jaysunhoffman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past week while attending a show on king st. The hotel was very clean the rooms were averaged sized. We asked for adjoining rooms and they granted it no problem. You have to pay for parking which is normal at any downtown hotel. The restaurant was way overpriced though for breakfast. We payed $97.00 a night because we booked through Hotwire. Check it out if your downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Not the place for young respectful people.”
Reviews.Author: HouseOfHearts
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and walking down the hallway feels as though you are on a beautiful cruise ship. The breakfast at the Watermark was great with beautiful view of the lake & great service. You are a 5 minute walk to all the sports & cultural centers. The downside is the women that checked us in seemed a bit annoyed we where there and we where put on a floor full of young partiers. So young respectful people need not stay here unless you want be woken up by loud drunks in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - not a good place if your looking for quietness”
Reviews.Author: guyrox
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in order to be downtown - great location - close to the highway so it was great to escape the city in the morning. The rooms were small and very basic. I stayed on the side facing the street so it was very noisy during the night and they didn't have opaque curtains so the room was very bright from the street lights. Had to pay for parking which was a bit pricey so plan to add a little if you have a car. Nevertheless, price was OK for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: sabdb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights right after Christmas. Despite initial disappointments because Radisson had canceled my reservation without informing me and a few misinformed employees, the problem was solved by an attentive employee and we were on our way. I really like the Harbourfront location because while it is close to many attractions and the streetcars stop right in front of the hotel, it is quiet enough to allow a good night of sleep. The room was clean and comfortable. The sleep number beds are definitely a bonus too. Parking was 21 dollars per day, which is actually quite reasonable for the area. Some hotels charge up to 50 dollars. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: akide
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location for one night, was checked in quickly with no issues. Room was clean, however the washroom is a bit dated and could use a refresh. A new 37 inch LCD TV was in our room, with free wifi Internet. Location was quiet due to the winter season, but there are lots of activites closeby (Harbourfront Centre - had free outdoor ice skating with a deejay playing music). The CN Tower, Rogers Centre, Air Canada Centre are also closeby. No issues at all with this location, I did not eat at the restaurant in the hotel so can't really comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Ho Hum”
Reviews.Author: KFPx2
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms on line a month or so in advance, and utilized the pay in advance feature which saved us a few dollars. Knowing that we were definitely going to be using the rooms - we were not concerned about the no refund policy going with the lower price. Big mistake. When we arrived at the hotel - late as anticipated - everything concerning the reservations were in order. We went to our room - on the fifth floor - facing the street - Queens Quay West. The constant clanging of the street car kept us awake most of the night. As other reviewers have stated, the room itself was nicely appointed with a flat screen TV, working desk and free internet. Unfortunately, the selection of television stations was limited at best with several childrens cartoon stations, two foreign language stations and a few other English channels....not terribly conducive to relaxing and watching TV. We had breakfast one morning in the hotels restaurant. The quality of the food was good but definitely pricey. Despite being advertised as offering lunch & dinner - it was not to be had...nor was room service...much to our dismay. The button on the phone for room service didnt work and only when I inquired was I told it was not being offered. I could get food in the restaurant next door if I wanted.....hummm that is far from room service. Bottom line - this property is over priced for the quality.The property looks tired, has limited amenities and the staff are mediocre at best. We will not be recommending it to our friends - nor staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly and good for business travel”
Reviews.Author: mcahill6912
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Admiral Toronto is right on the harbor and with easy taxi access to the entire city. The rooms are spacious with two queen size beds, a desk, lounge chair and matching ottoman. There was a flat screen TV and free Wi-Fi. There was plenty of space in the closet for hanging your cloths. I like a bathroom with a soap dish and this bathroom had a glass soap dish on the marble counter. Very nice but your mileage may vary. Overnight parking is a little expensive but given the congestion in the city itself it is worth it. They do let you park after checkout until 6:00 PM which is nice if you want to do additional shopping in Toronto. This hotel must be a popular business destination because there were many conference rooms. There is a very nice 5th floor restaurant, very open and overlooking the pool which is closed in the winter. Average breakfast buffet but it is right there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Chanakyan45
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with good location overlooking the harbour and the lake Ontario.The reception staff are efficient and courteous.The room was clean,bed comfortable.The free Wi Fi ia a bonus but it is slow.The breakfast is adequate.The restaurant menu is typical north american,not much variety.The hotel is close to major attractions.The tram and bus stops are within walking distance.The Sightseeing bus has a stop just outside the entrance.There are good restaurants and a mini market on Queens Way West.I stayed here for a week and would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Chantal1984
Reviews.Content: I went on a business trip in Toronto and we stayed at the Radisson Admiral, where we held one of our workshops. I had a room on the second floor, it needs a little uplifting but it was clean. I had pigeons in my windows during the day, but it didn't bother me since I wasn't in my room all day. The staff is really nice and they give great service. The food was really good and their location is just wonderful. The harbour is great for walks and just to sit and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Fall working weekend with great view”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Q
Reviews.Content: This weekend was my second stay at the Radisson Admiral for a conference. The accommodations were great and the view was beautiful. Friendly staff and great meeting rooms, some with that spectacular harbour view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Views”
Reviews.Author: ASAP211
Reviews.Content: There are not too many hotels offering views like this in this area. It is more like a resort style hotel. This hotel is wonderful for leisure travel but if you have a rental car is also a good location for getting about in the city. The rooms themselves are better than the average with better furnishings and extra space. Front desk staff were extremely helpful with booking and the restaurant better than most. This is one of the better hotels that I have stayed in in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Toronto Location”
Reviews.Author: ambrose6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to return to the UK. It is located on the lakeshore in a quiet area. Bus tours of the city depart from the front door and the Rogers Centre and CN Tower are in easy walking distance, so, for a short stay and "quick feel" of Toronto it is an ideal location. More importantly for us the hotel was very easy to reach by car with ample parking in the underground lot (at C$21/night).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great-customer service was not.”
Reviews.Author: Renata B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great corner room. We went to dinner with the blinds open, and on our stroll back, noticed they were closed. We went to the front desk, and the receptionist said turn down service was available upon request.Because we did not make that request, we asked her to confirm that it was done. She COULD NOT, and there was not a list of rooms that had been turned down, and there was no one available to ask. Also, there was no security to accompany us to our room(thankfully I was not traveling alone.) Before I could address the situation, we had received a survey froom the Radisson. We told them of our complaint. NO RESPONSE. A week later, my husband wrote an e-mail directly to Radisson. Still NO RESPONSE. Our room had a great view, and the bed was more than comfy, but the fact that our privacy was breeched and no one cares really bothers me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Good Location...but NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: rx7suzy
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Radisson for a trade show at the convention center. The hotel is clean, staff is friendly and the rooms are nice. Its a 10 minute walk to the convention center, plenty of food right in the same building as the hotel. The only issue I had was the fact that you can hear the trolly cars going down the main room every few minutes. At first I thought it was the regional airport but realized they can't have that many flights. Its' the trollys. I'm a light sleeper so it was tough for me, I barely slept the whole time we were there. If it wasn't for that I'd give it 4 stars, but lack of sleep doesn't make for a perky business traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a family vacation in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: RQH123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 7 year old stayed in August of this year. Great location for visiting the CN Tower and surrounding area. I haven't been to the Toronto harbour front in a few years and was very impressed with what has been done there. It was very nice to stroll along the water and watch the boats. There is also a nice open air theatre there. From the very nice pool deck at the hotel you can sit with a drink, and listen to the music from the theatre while watching planes take off from Toronto Island. All this while the kids play in the pool. We will definately be back next year! Only issue was that I couldn't get the WiFi to work in the room but I just used the small business centre and was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great location, lovely swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Karen C
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in Aug 2011 with family (2 adults, 2 children (11, 13) in a room with 2 large beds. Good sized room for family clean and modern, good facilities, plenty of storage. Hotel welcoming and friendly. Hotel pool on roof was lovely - even in the rain! Breakfast was good, with nice service. Had view of lake from the room which was fabulous. Very good location, relaxing by the waterside but near to Rogers Centre (for baseball) we went 3 times we all surprisingly loved it, and the CN tower. Transport to shops / other areas by street car which stops outside the hotel. Not in heart of entertainment or shopping but excellent for a relaxing City break.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting Oasis in Downtown TO”
Reviews.Author: ChequeMark
Reviews.Content: I had the oportunity to spend a weekend in Toronto on busness and decided to take my family along for the experience. The arrival at the Radisson was a little difficult as depending on the direction you arrive from a little navagation may be required to get to the enterence due to one way streets. Once you arrive, parking is the next challenge. We were fortunate that an other car was just leaving as we arrived. Check in was typical DT hotel, impersonal but efficient. Parking was arranged with check in and we parked and then trecked out bags to the room. The room was a pleasant surprise. Our expectastions were somewhat low based on the codition of the lobby and elevators (shall we say dated?) but the room was up to date in its appointments and finishes. I am not a big fan of the sleep number bed system but it did provide a allowed for some comfortable sleep and the kids liked playing with the controls. The pool was an oasis within the city and frankly was completely unexpected. The kids had a great time and my wife and I were able to spend some quality time with the family. The location is very good, in close proximity to the downtown core as well as destinations like the CN Tower and Skydome (Rogers Centre). If youare looking for a clean comfortable place to stay in the city centre, look no further than thid hotel. 4 of 5 stars !

Reviews.Title: “Good but Pricey!”
Reviews.Author: pbUSA
Reviews.Content: Late on the review and the stay was September 2010 (not an available choice). Chose this hotel for the location for walking to the ball game and CN Tower and the convenience of the street cars right outside for getting to the other points of interest. The price was very high but can't beat the location. Check in/check out went smoothly, front desk staff was helpful when asking questions about the public transportation . Room was nice and clean although the bathroom was rather small and outdated. DId have a view of the water and street cars could be heard but it wasn't an issue. Beds were comfortable. Paid at time of reservation to have breakfast and it was outstanding! It was buffet and the choices were amazing. So many fresh fruits to choose from! Only drawback to this location is the parking. Not that is was paid parking as that is the usuall in any downtown area, but the dark dingy dirty undground areas and hallways you have to go thru to get to the hotel. Don't try it with your luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: KateH2010
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Radisson. Throughout our stay the front desk employees were helpful and courteous. The location is great it is easy to get to from the airport on the Gardiner Expressway and it is a cheap cab to downtown if you don't want the hassle of parking. ($12 to Eaton Center) Hotel parking is $21 a day with in and out privileges. The hotel has sleep number beds and I found it very comfortable. I appreciated the complimentary bottles of water in the room. We enjoyed a quick dip in the pool however it felt cool mainly because of the wind rather than the actual pool temperature. On a calm day the patio by the pool area would be the perfect place to sit and enjoy a glass of wine or cocktail while enjoying the view of the lake. We tried to go to the hotel bar the first night however it closed relatively early (10 p.m.) There is a bar adjoining the hotel on the street level so there were other options nearby. The hotel is in close proximity to good amenities. There is a well stocked convenience store Rabba across the road and there is a Starbucks within walking distance. There is also a supermarket within walking distance. (I like walking so some people may consider it to far to walk) We had dinner at Pier 4 Storehouse Restaurant. The waterfront location is perfect however overall we were very disappointed with our experience there. The food is very boring and yet the prices are comparable to many upscale restaurants. After this experience I looked at the Open Table reviews before we booked our next dinner out. The next night we went to Jump and had a great experience there. If you like really good wine it is worth paying the $25 corkage fee. There is a LCBO store on Queens Quay West that has a great selection of wines. There were four adults in our party at Jump and everyone thoroughly enjoyed all the dishes they had selected. The breakfast at the Radisson is good. Standard hotel prices (however not too crazy). The portions were generous. A great hotel with reasonable prices by Toronto standards.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in need of an update.”
Reviews.Author: marylandtravel007
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great -- especially if you have harbor-view room, which we did not. There's a somewhat dark walk beneath a highway to get from the waterfront to the restaurants and shops and indoor sports stadium downtown, but a streetcar stop is right in front of the hotel and the streetcar is easy to use. The worst thing about the hotel was the bathroom. It was something from the 1960s with a shower/tub combination. The plastic curtain did not keep the shower water from soaking most of the bathroom floor. The entire hotel, in fact, seemed rather old and tired.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kathyras
Reviews.Content: First class service right from the front desk to restaurant to room attendants. Buffet breakfast was wonderful. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “City hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: CracowDanang
Reviews.Content: The hotel has fantastic location right on the Harborfront, very close to the promenade and Tower, with downtown within walking distance. Great view from rooms on highest floors and from the rooftop terrace. The room was a little bit too small, but generally clean and modern. Large bed, free WiFi, no fridge, walls were not full soundproof. Cleanning and room service every day. The bathroom was O.K. however not new one; some things were tired. The buffet breakfast was rich and tasty. The small gym and an outdor pool (I didn't used it) are available for the guests. The staff were mostly friendly, check-in/out procedures without any problems. Generally it's not bad choice for city break in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, would return again, beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Kelly78
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights and from start to finish the hotel was excellent. Speedy and friendly check in. Rooms really clean, fantastic view of the CN tower! Room is showing a little wear and tear but nothing major. Plently of storage space and a big room, really comfy bed. Had breakfast in the hotel every morning, not the cheapest option but HUGE portions that kept us going until evening. Standard of the restaurant food in the evening was great, staff very friendly during all meals. Pool area was great with brillant views. And yeah, no safe in room but the conciege Michael was so helpful that it was no trouble to ask him for the key every morning (you needed his key along with your own to get in the safe). Location is beautiful on the habour, plently of restaurant choices. I would stay no where else but this hotel if I was to return to Toronto! Best hotel Ive stayed in for along while.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PureManky
Reviews.Content: Good hotel ... reasonably priced and reasonably central to all ... big walks to the town centre however. Staff were reasonably helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: midnightomidnight
Reviews.Content: I booked a three day package online (prepaid). I found the room to be extremely well kept with great decor. I purchased a city view room (waterfront room was slightly higher cost). I looked directly at the CN Tower (pretty cool). You are right near the water and there are many places convenient within walking distance. I did through out my back packing and had to cut my trip short by a day but was reimbursed for that even though I had a special pre-pay rate which I was very pleased by. Will definitely stay here for future Toronto travel.

Reviews.Title: “Second time, looking forward to the next.”
Reviews.Author: Danny W
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, great location, comfy beds, good breakfast and friendly staff. All in all we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, value and service + the view”
Reviews.Author: SafetyHarbor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days on business. The location is on the Waters edge with a number of Restaurants handy. easy access to the waterfront and plent of walking paths and areas to take in the view. The breakfast is substantial , the pool area is substantial and the view is a bonus.The room was a good size, in good condition with silent effective air conditioning. The taxi stand is right in front and the trip to and from the Airport seamless. When travelling to the US from here the US immigration takes place in Toronto prior to departure, so leave an extra hour for that as the line waiting was very long.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice, good staff with one major flaw”
Reviews.Author: da_drow
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed Radisson Admiral Habourfront for Caribana weekend. The hotel is nice. Comfortable and well appointed and very clean. There was one guy that worked at the front desk (very, tall, thin and blonde) he was particularly helpful. And the other front desk clerk (Indian or middle eastern) she remembered my request for a fridge and when one became available at the end of our stay it was bought to our room. Imagine the hotel staff remembering or caring enough to fulfill a request 3 days latter. We enjoyed the pool during our stay. It was pretty, with great views and lots of lounge chairs. Ate at the restaurants for both lunch and breakfast. Food is decent. The burgers were outstanding everything else decent. Wait staff nice and helpful. The only complaint I had was no safes in the room. They have a vault down stairs that has to be opened with your key and the hotel key simultaneously. It was inconvenient to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corvette8
Reviews.Content: Solid, good hotel with beautiful location waterfront. Nice enough poolarea but to few sunbeds. We had a juniorsuite; expensive but nice!

Reviews.Title: “Big expectations”
Reviews.Author: abat
Reviews.Content: Well, we've booked 2 rooms (family with 3 children) because we can't realy fit ourselves easily in one room and payed 320 Can. Dollars plus taxes without breakfast. Had a room in the back side of the Hotel overlooking a parking lot. Nevermind about that. Positive remarks. The room was big, with 2 double comfortable beds. The bathroom was also quite big. Wifi internet was free (quite low speed but worked properly) Negative remarks. There was no safety in the room and every time you needed to go to the reception, ask for the safety, sigh the paper, escorted by the front desk assistant etc. Closet was a joke. A corner before the bathroom turned to a closet with a hanging rail and an iron board. OK take it easy. It's not that it's a big deal but when you pay almost 180 dolars per room some amenities should be in average level. Carpet was old and decoration also looked very tiring. The point that make me rate this hotel as a poor one was the Breakfast issue. We had breakfast and we payed almost 90 Dollars! Breakfast was 15 per person plus taxes, plus gratitude (adult), half price for children under 12. My second son is 12 and 1/2 and honestly I've told to the waiter who charged him as adult! Alright someone can say it's no big deal but another waiter the day of our arrival mentioned,depending in the quantity the consume!!!. That was funny. When you're paying more than 370 canadian dollars per night for 2 rooms, it's really ridiculous to pay another 90 dollars for breakfast. And the Breakfast buffet? Bacon and eggs, 3-4 types of cereal and some fruits. One type of yogurt, no bread we had to ask the waiter to bring us some, no water, same call the waiter, no cheese selection, as a matter of fact not any single piece of cheese, no ham, no, no. Croisant? Yes. They must have been there over a week. It was really ridiculous. Because we were travelling from Europe we only had one adaptor to charge our mobile phones. We've asked in the reception for a spare, they told us go to the store! The store was inside the Hotel, selling basic accessories in double or triple price. We've bought a single adapter for 5,8 dollars (Could got 4 in a pack in the airport for the same price, silly me). Staff of the Hotel, Front desk, concierge, average level, cleaning in the room was very good. If I will stay again in this Hotel? I don't think so. Location was right in front of the lake but you needed a good 10-15 minutes walk to get to Front and Yonge street where you can tell that center of Toronto starts. P.S. Coffeemachine in the room? Yes. Hair dryer? Yes. Did they operate together in the 2 plugs in the bathroom? No! Only one by one

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelbug0807
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - only about 2 blocks from Rogers Stadium (perfect if you're attending a baseball game - which we were!) & the CN Tower. Very nice, clean rooms. Helpful, personable staff. We took the Kajama Tall Ship tour on Lake Ontario on a beautiful sunny day - very relaxing with a great view of the city and the CN tower. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “You're paying for location!”
Reviews.Author: ATMGrrl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty standard. Nothing stood out as different from all the other hotels except you're on the harbor. My boyfriend and I stayed in a romantic harborview room. It was very well appointed. Coincidentally, we also stayed in a standard room. (checked out and stayed with friends, then checked back in). The standard room was still pretty nice, but not quite as well as the previous room. Staff was forgettable. Not great, not complain-worthy. Sorry, we didn't try the restaurant as it was under construction. The best part is the location. As long as you're planning on going to a ball game or the CN Tower. Otherwise, it's a bit of a treck to the subways. But there are streetcars out front. All in all, pleasant but forgettable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but....”
Reviews.Author: ajhaeh
Reviews.Content: As per previous correspondents, the Radisson is ideally placed on Queens Quay at the Harbour front. Next door to the Police Harbour front Marina, the hotel offers rooms that have lake or city views. Transport links are right outside the hotel with the street cars and the CN Tower and Blu Jays stadium is a 10 minute walk away. Our check in was fine but the staff on the whole were quite frosty. No concierge, no bags to the room, room key allocated and then â€˜elevators are round the cornerâ€™. Donâ€™t get me wrong, I donâ€™t want the staff to treat me as a long lost friend but they have an opportunity to really sell the place to the customer and for me they failed on this one. They didnâ€™t explain what facilities the hotel had to offer or where things were. After visiting several Radissons recently and hotels worldwide, my visit and welcome to the Radisson Admiral left me a little â€˜flatâ€™. The 8th floor room was fine, although showing its age in some parts. The view was of the Lake and the Harbour front, including the Police Marina. The bathroom furniture was 80â€™s retro and the bed although advertised & paid for as a Sleep Number Bed was not available. The receptionist stating that the company were no longer using them. A coffee machine was provided, large fridge and iron board. Cash deposit boxes were available at reception. As someone else has stated the room was very light in the mornings as there were a number of high windows that were not covered by blinds. Breakfast was good, $10 for cold buffet & $15 for hot. There was a large selection of fruit, cereals and juices etc. At least the server at breakfast had a little â€˜lifeâ€™ about him and was interested in the customers. He needs promoting! We dined one night in the hotel and used the 25% voucher given at reception. Unfortunately our choice was not available and the meal was not strictly as advertised on the menu. Quality was on the whole however was good. Check out was as cold and icy as when we arrived. â€˜There is your receipt.. goodbyeâ€™. Maybe itâ€™s me but I would have expected someone to ask how my stay had been, especially after the party the girls had in the corridor at 2am. Would I recommend this hotel to my friends and family... I donâ€™t think I would. Would I stay here again if I visited Toronto... I think I would look for somewhere a little more â€˜warmerâ€™.

Reviews.Title: “Great lakeside location with easy transit access to downtown”
Reviews.Author: Lambert B
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel on Lake Ontario in Toronto...in winter a bit remote, but easy access to downtown with transit, direct line to Chinatown on the west or Downtown shopping going east. close to CN Tower, the Dome and the harbourfront activities in the summer. clean spacious rooms, ask for a CN tower view

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: 5kmilesin2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few years ago and then, it was newly renovated so it was excellent. My room this time showed the years of wear, (bathtub faucet didn't work exactly right, and carpet was worn) but everything that could be cleaned was. Views are great in many rooms (lake view or city view), and not bad in others. It is a 10 min walk (or less) to the CN tower, and about 15 mins to AC Center. You do have to walk underneath the Gardiner Freeway for about minute to get to downtown which makes some uncomfortable. However, from a more rational perspective, I really didn't see anything to fear (no homeless folk or anything like that.) Didn't have much interaction with staff but seemed competent on check-in and check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view, Will return....”
Reviews.Author: sunpig09
Reviews.Content: Check in was very quick and efficent, we needed a early check in and there was no problem with that, Staff were fantatsic.. The room was very clean, bed was soooo comfy, bathroom was spotless. We asked for a view of city and did got that, it was a beautiful view. Location of this hotel was awesome within walking distance to ACC, Rogers center, eaton center, hockey hall of fame and much more.. We were there for a sports and shopping filled weekend so this hotel was a great location.. We ate at Shoeless Joes which was joined to the hotel and food was excellent.. The day we checked out our flight was late in evening so we checked out at 1 and they stored our luggage for us without hesistation.. Overall great experience and will definately go back...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Pat-newengland
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for business meetings. For our business, service staff was always courteous. The room I had was nicely decorated and very clean, but some furniture were a bit old. I had a fantastic view of the CN Tower. Beds were very comfortable and nights were quiet. Breakfast and lunch at the View dining room was good with a nice view of the lake. The only down points might be the lack of proper ventilation in the bathroom. The mirror got quickly fogged up. I also noticed several recessed lighting fixtures and HVAC grilles not fully attached on ceilings. There was also a heat problem in one meeting room where it was 76Â°F. Overall, this hotel is quite nice and in an awesome location on the lake with nice views. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Camel140791
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on February 02 & 03, 2011. This hotel is in an excellent location, close to downtown, minutes from Rogers Center, CN Tower and lots of entertainment venues. The rooms are large, extremely clean and quiet! We stayed on the city side and were not interrupted by the street cars or anything else for that matter. Front desk staff are awesome and I would recommend this property to anyone visiting Toronto. As good as our stay was I can imagine it would that much better in the summer being right on the lake with ready access to Toronto islands etc. Oh yeah the free WiFi was a bonus as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Darren2
Reviews.Content: Having recently visited Toronto on business I stayed at the Radisson for two nights. The front desk processed my check in extremely quickly and fulfilled all my requests. While the lobby is lacking visual appeal the rooms are nicely decorated and well kept. I had a wonderful view of the lake and the island airport. I flew in on porter and was just a hop, skip and jump away from my hotel room. I visited the restaurant for dinner one night and had breakfast both mornings. Excellent value for the money realizing that I was in a downtown hotel on the lake. The hotel has an excellent outdoor pool that I hear is well attended in the summer months. The pool overlooks the lake and airport, what a site to see. Recent improvements to the fitness facility show that the hotel is moving in a new direction with more improvements to come I was told by the employees. The rooms come equipped with a flat screen television and new pillow top mattresses. From all my frequent travels I would have to say this was the most relaxing trip. Kudos to the management team for the staff and services they provide an great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: winequaffer
Reviews.Content: I got a great price but an even better room. I face town but the CN tower too... it lights up all night. I loved the hotel. The bar/restaurant was quiet but food was great. There were loads of other restaurants within minutes because the area is on the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: abracadabra55
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights. Had great room with panoramic view over waterfront. Room was clean and very comfortable as was bathroom. Replenishment of water in fridge every day was much appreciated. Restaurant was excellent and reasonably priced. Staff in bar and restaurant were fantastic as were all reception staff too. Highly professional staff who went out of their way to make our stay as good as it was. Could not fault anything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base for Exploring Toronto”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanDakman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights with family and relatives in two rooms. Great views from room, great pool and deck overlooking lake. Great base for exploring the waterfront and downtown Toronto. Rooms comfortable for a short stay. Staff always helpful, parking easy, even when a Bon Jovi concert was next door. Plenty of restaurants close by. Loved getting the ferry to Toronto Islands and exploring by bike. Sleep selector beds a great idea - but two did not work though wife's did and she loved it.

Reviews.Title: “on the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: jeangh
Reviews.Content: Had a standard room at the Ramama Plaza Hotel Admiral in Toront and could see Lake Ontario and the Needle from our window. Location was great for catching the trolley to the Royal Ontario Museum, exploring Chinatown and was an easy walk to great restaurants and shops along the waterfront. Small hotel but good value and perfectly located for our needs

Reviews.Title: “Good, but far from perfect.”
Reviews.Author: scottino84
Reviews.Content: Well, the location is good: right on the waterfront, great views of the CN tower and of the harbour and Toronto island. Service was a bit lacking at times. One day out of 4 the room never got cleaned and I had to go to the front desk at 4:00pm to have it done. Even then, when it did get done, it wasn't done properly. One of the Sleep Number beds didn't work properly, it would only get firmer, not softer. Parking was expensive at $21 per day, but at least there was in and out privileges. Maybe others had a more perfect experience but there was some lack of attention to detail in my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality waterfront property”
Reviews.Author: sm105
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Admiral in Toronto is a quality hotel with an excellent waterfront location. Rooms are typically Radisson - comfortable and business friendly. Parking is available in the underground lot for a relatively reasonable $20/day. Dozens of restaurants and bars within walking distance and a 24 hour supermarket across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but lacked facilities”
Reviews.Author: Juggernaut666
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week whilst seeing Toronto. Room was quite small for a family with no fridge! Location by the harbour front very good but can be noisy if there are festivals on the lake front. Didn't eat at the restauarant but heard that the food was quite pricey from other guests. Spent quite a bit of time by the pool which was good but again probably needed some refurb. The water was warm but not particularly clean. The gap between the 2 buildings where the pool is certainly provides a wind tunnel. There is however a fantastic view of the tower! The staff at the poolside were very friendly and helpful. Despite being told to use a different card for payment the original card was debited prior to departure. Not good atall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice helpful staff, clean & tidy, relaxed location, needs better facilities”
Reviews.Author: dragek
Reviews.Content: Staying here for a 7 night break. Checked in and initially presented with the wrong room. Discussed with front desk who were helpful and they explained but quickly assigned the correct room. Room was as expected and very clean, think hotel has recently had a refurb. Throughout our staff, all the staff were very friendly and helpful and many of the FoH recognized us and were very polite. We had an issue one day with our son but the manager went out of her way to resolve the problem and quickly fixed everything, you couldn't of asked for more. The hotel has a pool which is outdoors and not bad for a city hotel, although it gets a little windy ;0). Breakfast is very nice and good value, service is great except fir one morning where we had to keep asking for things as they were too busy chatting!!! Hotel has a gym but is a lot to be desired, it has one bike, one step machine (broken) one rowing machine and one treadmill and finally one multiple machine with no attachments, don't bother with your gym gear! Wireless throughout is brilliant even at the poolside and hotel has a small business centre. Downside, no concierge so you need to ask reception desk, no porters but think that's standard for Radisson, parking is 21 dollars a day, location is nice on the harbour but all local restaurants are the typical tourist bars with grease food, you need to go further a field for a decent restaurant (but the sports bar joined to the hotel is great with really decent staff) and don't get a room at the front roadside otherwise you hear the trams every few minutes and at 1am it can keep you awake! Overall worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: digcape
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect because it is on the lake and within walking distance to Rogers Center and CN tower. Has nice pool area, restaurant and bar. Steps away from great restaurants and coffee shops. Would highly recommend! We checked in quite early and were given our room. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “lakefront location”
Reviews.Author: ceepeebeee
Reviews.Content: great location for city break.get one of the hop on hop off bus tickets ,terminates/starts right outfront.can then get to all city quickly but with the added bonus of being out of the centre on the lakeshore right next to cn tower and rogers centre .great views,breakfast v good value.service great

Reviews.Title: “I would have liked to have been informed ahead of time about parking fees.”
Reviews.Author: kw0xgy
Reviews.Content: Paid for cityview room 2 months in advance. What we got was a room overlooking the street where entrance to parking garage was located. Our view was of a brick wall. We were charged $42.00 for parking for a two night stay. We were not told or warned of this ahead of time. We found out about the fees when checking out. If we had paid for our own parking initially, it would have been a flat fee of $15.00 per day. Good location to Roger Center but will stay in US for the next major league game.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RedcarJenks
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and good views across the harbour. Reception staff were very helpful - problem with room was fixed within minutes of reporting and they also looked up route to the zoo and printed instructions.If you are happy to travel by street car and subway then the city is accessible for $3 by asking for a transfer ticket to allow travel to your destination on one ticket but a combination of types of transport.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: spryfieldCanada
Reviews.Content: We only spent 1 night here but were impressed by the friendly staff, clean and large rooms and above all the great waterfront location. Will be going back again for a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MidnightTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the ManU vs Celtic match after doing alot of rescearch as usual. I stayed on the city side, where as my buddy stayed with a lake view. The price was fine if you do a prepay which is a cheaper way to go if you're certain on your timings. I requested and received a higher floor room (6th floor) because I was concerned about noise from the street. It turned out to be fine with the higher floor. Curtains had two closures to shut out the light but the room had 45 degree upper windows which only had sheers. I'm an early riser so it really wasn't a big factor. Buddy's room had a great view of the harbour but of course he paid more for it. The buffet is a fair priced breakfast with good choices of sausage, bacon, potatoes, fruit, cereal, etc. For $15 for Toronto that's not bad. The pool and roof balcony was great with available service on it for drinks. Great way to have a coffee in the morning or a night cap later in the evening. Yes it did get a little crowded in the afternoon but it was too hot for me by then anyways. Only bad part was chair hogs (and I watched) who threw towels and a book down in the prime locations at 7 am, but who wouldn't show till 2 pm. Also apparently general public is not allowed in until noon. The location can't be beat with lots in the area. Try the Watermark restaurant and pub down the Harbour or PJ Obrien's downtown. Only other note I would make is the front staff could be a bit more welcoming. The rest of the staff were great. Also in pictures the rooms you see with the balconies are privately owned condos.

Reviews.Title: “The Radisson was Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: husky088
Reviews.Content: I chose the Radisson as I was going to see Bon Jovi at the Rogers Centre and I had read that it was only a 5 min. walk away...and it was. My room was quite nice. It faced the courtyard and after reading some of the reviews I thought I would be lying awake listening to the streetcars all night but that wasn't the case...could barely hear them. I enjoyed the pool on the 5th floor but did notice it was filled with 20-something's for most of the afternoon. I found if I went there in the morning or late day there were more people in my age group and I didn't feel so self-conscious. It was nice to swim in the pool and see the CN Tower and also look out to the view of the Harbour. The Radisson is in a great location and I would def. stay there again. I read some reviews that you couldn't close the curtains. Our room had sheers for the daytime and then curtains to pull across at night so there wasn't a problem. I will def. stay there again as I love the location and the Pier 4 Restaurant next door is awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Roger's Center, ACC and CN Tower”
Reviews.Author: Roland100
Reviews.Content: Rooms need a makeover !!!! Filfy carpet ! For the price it should have been a suite. Very good location, breakfast buffet was just acceptable, it was the same price as a couple of eggs, bacon/sausage homefries and toast. Be aware, parking at this hotel is an additional 20+ per night and watch what you drive, it may be too high to fit underground. SW

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem at Toronto Harborfront Area”
Reviews.Author: Barb-Steve
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Rooms was spacious, bed very comfortable, Pool area was FANTASTIC!!!!!!!!!!! with a great view of teh waterfront and toronto islands. Right in the middle of everything with great walking trails on the East and West side. Like I said, a hidden gem which should be experienced.

Reviews.Title: “The best location for the Toronto waterfront”
Reviews.Author: 24Travel7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the July 4th weekend for two nights. The location is excellent - right on the waterfront with lots of people everywhere. The sightseeing bus stops right in front of the hotel. Our room was comfortable and the bed was so relaxing that I had my best sleep in months. The staff was very pleasant and helpful and even the gift store staff were too. Overall, if you want your homebase while visiting Toronto to be at Harbourfront Centre -this is the place for you. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great view”
Reviews.Author: WoodlandsSingapore
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in June to take a day tour to Kingston for visiting the 1000 Islands. We fully enjoyed the harbourfront area, its view, restaurant, shopping, etc. The hotel lobby is not very big, but there is a business centre and other facilities on the 2nd floor. The internet access there is free and unlimited. The room we stayed in has partial harbourfront view. It is clean, and everything works well. Taxi provides quick and easy access from and to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but very loud”
Reviews.Author: carpenoctemBerlin
Reviews.Content: The location at the harbourfront is great. But as their is a very old tram going past the hotel every 5 minutes it is very loud, even when the window is closed. also, on the top floor it was not possible to close the curtains, thatswhy i got up to at 5 a.m. so overall not a place for me to re-visit, although i loved the marina nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view and location”
Reviews.Author: mtl-wasa
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Admiral Hotel Toronto Harbourfront is located in the nice Harbourfront area in Toronto. The rooms have huge windows and it is simply amazing to be in bed and admiring the view of the lake. However, the view is not so nice if you get a city view room. It is also important to know that the hotel is located on Queen's Quay St which has a street car running until 2 am which makes it noisy if you stay in a city view room. Even on the side rooms you can hear the street cars if you are a light sleeper. But the rooms are very nice and spacious, well decorated and with very comfortable beds. The restaurant on site is beautiful and the food is delicious. I was hoping to enjoy the outdoor pool and the spectacular view from it but it was under construction while I stayed there in May.

Reviews.Title: “The room was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Besties
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights over the weekend for a post wedding reception at the Steam Whistle Brewery. The brewery was a 2 minute walk away, which was really handy! The hotel lobby was clean and the staff were very friendly. We stayed in a studio room and it was amazing! It was beautifully decorated with tons of windows and a telescope! The bed was very confortable; we slept great. The only bad thing about the room was the shower. The shower head was clogged so not much water was coming through or straying off in different directions. Overall the room was great! The pool was under construction at the time and I wish they would have let me know that when I booked the room. The in house restaurant called the Watermark was nice, but the dinner meal was terrible. We had the hamburger and the fettucini and it tasted REALLY bad. They do however have a really great breakfast buffet - definetly try it. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel called Shoeless Joes and we had a great time there. The food was good - try the sweet potato fries with the spicy mayo. The staff were friendly and the other patrons were great too! Overall, we had a great time and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Very Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ivanciment
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here during a stopover in Toronto. Harbourfront area is a great location to visit with small kids; super convenient to the City airport (although don't believe that it is a 5 minute walk to the terminal -- it is 15 minute walk or a 5 minute / 7 dollar taxi ride). Service was very friendly and prompt. The corner studio room is really nice with a cool view but somewhat impractical in that the shades do not really block out sunlight and cannot be raised either (making the telescope in the room somewhat cute but useless). It did connect well however to an adjoining room which was necessary for our family visit with kids. Weak points here are the gym and the breakfast buffet -- the a la carte items however were very good. TV channel lineup is good; BBC World is on the list. We would definitely consider returning to this hotel if we were in the area. Previous visit to the Westin a few years ago left us with a poor impression of that hotel in comparison. Hotel has a taxi rank right in front which makes it easy to get up and go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very affordable”
Reviews.Author: LuciaGrosner
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Radisson (May 6 to 9, 2010), and I really loved the hotel. Excellent location, nice staff, very clean and comfortable. I've paid more for not that nice places, I think this hotel is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: kesibmik
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. A few blocks away from Rogers Centre and the CN Tower. Loved the pool as it had a deep end! Many attractions in the area and lots of dining options. Right on the harborfront so great views all around.

Reviews.Title: “1 Nite at the Harbourfront”
Reviews.Author: Loftypines
Reviews.Content: T.O. has a real nice waterfront especially around the Radisson Hotel. The hotel is very convenient to the TTC and has a grocery store right across the road and a coffee shop just next door. Many attractions close by. In the summer there are boat tours, bike or rollerblade rentals and the hotel has what seemed to be a great outdoor pool. The hotel itself is very clean (not sold on the sleep number beds) but the rest of the room was very acceptable. parking is $21/day. If your there on the weekend a family TTC pass is $10. I got a $55 nite rate from priceline. I think if you get a chance to spend a couple of nice warm summer nites here it would be great with the pool, waterfront, walking paths all at your fingertips. The ROM and Ontario Science center are not worth the money

Reviews.Title: “pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: ManagementRespond
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel with our two lovely children on canada day and we enjoy lot of our couple of days. Front desk staffs are very co-operative and friendly. Our children enjoyed lake view and ontario place fire work from hotel. We like to stay again and 100%recommend to our friends. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: binky49
Reviews.Content: What a great stay here .......the hotel was clean, staff were friendly and helpful, the area was full of choices from fine dining to casual fare all within a few blocks. The spa was attached to the hotel and was just as nice and friendly. One day here and I just had to stay another!!! Sorry boss. I could of stayed all week and still not have taken in all that the area had to offer. Definitely a 10++ . I highly recommend this place for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Sight and A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: merryl44
Reviews.Content: Our stay at raddison hotel brought joy and wonderful memories for me and my friend.The hotel is very clean,have good service and the staffs are very friendly.The harbourfront by itself brings delight to the sight and it was so good to stroll there anytime of the day.The view is awesome and terrific.Can't ask for more in staying there.It's just near downtown Toronto so everything is accessible from there.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: AstrComm
Reviews.Content: Last week, my wife and I took a few days off from the regular day-to-day and decided to stay closer to the lake than we usually do. Front desk staff were very pleasant, helpful, and efficient. Our 6th-floor room (though not large) was clean, quiet, and comfortable, with a king bed, arm chair, and ottoman. From the west-facing window, we had a partial view of Lake Ontario and the Toronto Island Airport to the south, and the SkyDome (sorry, Rogers Centre) to the north. As well as being in the heart of the Harbourfront area, the hotel is within walking distance of the Air Canada Centre, CN Tower, Eaton Centre, Metro Convention Centre, and Rogers Centre. (Though we walked to the Eaton Centre area for dinner and shopping, then to the Second City theatre for a hilarious show, we treated ourselves to a cab ride back.) I can't comment on restaurant and other services, because the only one we used was the Business Centre, to check emails. Our next trip to Toronto will likely be based from "the Admiral." PS. Underground self-parking cost an extra 21$/day, and extends for several hours after checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel, can get it through Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: David4758
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights, having booked through Hotwire for $70 per night (including taxes) which was an amazing bargain. Excellent location by the waterfront close to CN Tower and stadium, large comfortable room, and very quiet. Also car parking in basement of hotel (this was extra, about $20 per day). If coming by car, it's very easy to find from the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. View of CN Tower from room”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer1001
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. Great location, easy access to downtown attractions. CN Tower just across the road. On the street car route so can get further a field if necessary but found most things within walking distance. Desk staff friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. Didnâ€™t eat at the hotel but the bar/restaurant just next door, Shoeless Joeâ€™s, was a nice place to eat and have a drink at the end of the day. If you have time pop round to Wheel Excitement just round the back of the hotel and rent a bike. We rode up to the Humber Bridge along the cycle path all the way along the lake front, it was really nice

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location beside the water, with amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: Cruiseaholic55
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights here during our Toronto visit this Sept. Loved the location, right beside water! We were on top floor, the 8th, with a full width picture window, overlooking the harbour, lake, islands. One of the best room locations we have had in years! (if you are staying here, it is definitely worth the extra to get a lake view room) The pool area is small, but neat and spotless, and overlooks the lake, with plenty of comfy loungers, chairs and tables. Staff were all very friendly and offered a good service. The buffet breakfast (which is extra) has a wonderful selection of fresh fruits, cereals, breads etc, but the 'hot' entree included in buffet rate, was always luke warm and kept warm for far too long. Would be far better to take individual orders and cook fresh for each guest. Rooms were large, with king size beds, but very disappointly had no fridge (and there was ample room for several!!) One thing we disliked was the fact that the tea making facilities and ice bucket are in the bathroom! This to me is not hygienic, and there is a large desk in the room, which could easily accomodate tea/coffee making items. Having it in same room as toilet not appealing!! Parking is available below hotel at 22dollars per day, which is good. But as hotel is just a few blocks from all the 'must see' tourist areas, there is no need to use the car, during a stay here. Hotel is 5mins walk to CN tower and Rogers centre. Also has the ticket office for the open top bus ride 'Bus and Boat company' beside hotel.....by the way, this is a must buy, as you can get on and off bus as often as you like for a full week for same price, and you have a boat trip around harbour and islands thrown in! We made great use of this, and manged to see a huge amount of sites in our 4 days. The walk along the prom in front of the hotel is lovely, with dozens of restaurants to try every night...spoiled for choice! And there is so much going on in this harbourfront area that we never got bored. There is a restaurant called Pier 4 just in front of hotel at waters edge, which as well as serving good food, has a huge collection of maritime memorabilia. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Radisson, and would definitely stay there again, if we are in Toronto. The location is great...where else can you stay in a large busy city, and look out at the water, walk along a prom, go out on boat trips, sunbathe, and still be within minutes of all the city buzz, if you need it?

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great price”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloPundit
Reviews.Content: We were in Toronto for a concert at the Rogers Centre - you can't get more convenient than this comfortable Radisson directly on the waterfront. It's fantastic to be able to exit a crowded venue and walk 2 blocks to your hotel, avoiding all the traffic hassle. The hotel itself is smallish, the parking is very convenient ($20/day), and you're convenient to loads of touristy Toronto stuff. During our 2-night stay, there was a Taiwanese festival being held in the park next door. Our king room was spacious without too many frills, and for a $82/nite Hotwire rate was absolutely spot-on.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: jofoo
Reviews.Content: The perfect location with the CN Tower and Rogers centre close by, 2 of the 3 hop-on-hop-off tour buses stop outside the hotel. I would recommend the Bus and Boat tour as it is slightly cheaper and your ticket lasts for up to 7 days a perfect way to get around the city. Room was a decent size with much welcomed air conditioning. All staff were friendly and there no problems throughout our stay. The buffet breakfast was nice and the pool was pleasant on a warm summer evening.

Reviews.Title: “What a great choice - fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: igar75
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located, as the name suggests, on the harbourfront just south of downtown Toronto. The area immediately around the hotel includes restuarants, bars, an 'urban beach', entertainment complexes, 24-hour grocery shopping, etc. There is a streetcar stop outside the hotel, from where streetcars rattle regularly into Union Station, from where Toronto's transport hub is based. Failing that, downtown is only a 15 minute stroll away via the Skywalk. In short, the location was just about perfect for a week's stay in the city. The reception staff were friendly, and made check-in a quick and painless experience. During our stay, we did have the need to use the hotel's concierge service, and found it as helpful as you could ever want. Rooms were always cleaned promptly and well, and the breakfast staff were friendly and happy to cater to our every need. In fact, the breakfast was very impressive. Despite thinking of new foods to try every morning, the breakfast staff always managed to serve exactly what we asked for. The food was plentiful and extremely good. We didn't eat evening dinner in the hotel, preferring instead to go onto the harbourfront and enjoy the many nearby restaurants (and can particularly recommend Shoeless Joe's for a hearty feast, which connects to the hotel via a door in the reception). The rooms were excellent - the beds were comfortable (although the special air-filled beds were, in our opinion, not necessary and didn't really add anything to the sleeping experience). Our only grumble was that swimming pool. It is located on an open-air terrace within the hotel. The pool certainly didn't appear to be heated (although we were informed that it was "slightly heated"), and the surrounding sides of the hotel did mean it was shady and windy in parts. The coldness of the pool did mean we didn't use it to its full potential. Would we come back? Yes, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “And If You Choose........Choose Wisely!!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Observer
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this property on July 31st. UTTER CHAOS!! It was Caribana in Toronto and the best of this festival was reaching it's climax. The staff looked to be confused at check-in. Judging from some of the reviews I read before going, I was SURE to ask about my reservation: (1) "I reserved a sleep number king bed, right?" - - - Answer: "ummmm, yes." (2) "My room is suppose to be over looking the harbour, right?" - - - Answer: "ahhhh. Oops! (a little typing), Yes." (3) "I requested a high floor, right?" - - - Answer: "Yes, sir." So far, so good. Then things started happening the very next morning. The coffee maker was defective. Maid service was not done until 2:00 PM. These things might sound small, but they are a prelude to bigger things happening. On the second day of stay, I left the hotel so that I would miss any situation that might come up. On returning at 4:00 PM, my room was not cleaned at all. I reported this to the manager and he immediately sent housekeeping up to my room. When I saw the maid who took care of the "entire" floor, she was almost in tears and "actually" running from room to room. I told her to just take the trash and give me some towels and we will call it even for that day. The point of all this is, its just not the hotel that can look bad, but how MANAGEMENT run it. Sure, I will tell others about The Radisson. But what others expect from the Radisson can give them a bad name.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - great pool - pro staff”
Reviews.Author: TSV
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here with my family - and I loved it. The rooms are nice and clean - and there is free internet access. The pool area is just wonderful, and the location is perfect. I found the staff to be very helpful and able to "think for themselves". They came across as very professional. Breakfast was good with an amazing variety of fruit and berries... and of course cereals, muffins, toast, eggs etc. I'd stay there again. The stay wasn't luxurious, but somehow everything had an extra something, and that made it very easy to be a guest there.

Reviews.Title: “oasis of peace and serenity on the lake in a big and busy city”
Reviews.Author: Zazix
Reviews.Content: This hotel has best views in Toronto. I stayed in a corner studio room with a glass wall offering a view over lake Ontario, islands and the marina. Even the bathroom had a glass wall. A telescope was provided in the room to have a better look at the harbour islands. I booked a romance package so we had a chance to enjoy sparkling wine and strawberries in the room. Other amenities included an electric fireplace, plasma tv, coffee maker and special adjustable mattress - - which you may make harder of softer using the attached control. Standard rooms are also large and offer lake views. Especially nice is watching the sun rise over the Ontario lake while have breakfast in the restaurant. It gives a resort feeling and you forget that this is one of the busiest cities in North America. Breakfast was delicious with fresh berries, fresh juice, hot toasts, omelette, ham etc. A glasswall separates the restaurant from an open terrace with an open swimming pool. The pool opens only in summer months, so i didnt have chance to use. Instead i used the terrace for taking pictures of the lake Ontario and the CN tower. We were desperately looking for a smoking area, but unfortunately smoking is allowed only outside. We went to Pier 4 restaurant for dinner - right next to the Admiral on the pier as its name suggests. Excellent stakes and fresh fish and seafood. Peep in to look at the "fishing" decor as well. Harbourfront is a land reclamed from the lake (original water front was at the level of the Front street) and represents a park area with open cafes in summer and skating ring in winter. It is a good idea to take lunch or dinner cruise on Ontario - thus you will be able to take "postcard view" pictures of the Toronto skyline. The harbourfront has a very relaxed atmosphere compared to the neighbouring business district. Though it took us 15 min to walk to our partners' offices in one of the main towers. The hotel is at walking distance from the CN tower, Yonge street, Eaton center. I think this is the best choice for a romantic weekend in Toronto or for cultural tourism to this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel - poor customer service!”
Reviews.Author: dpedin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with our 12 year old daughter. The hotel were using the room next to ours for a corporate event and the noise of people partying went on to the early hours. We complained regularly to the hotel staff but to little avail and we were only offered another room at midnight on our last night! I complained on departure and the manager promised faithfully to sort it out for me - we agreed a 25% discount off our bill which had been prepaid via expedia - needless to say I have still to receive any contact from the hotel and will be following this up myself! This is a shame because the hotel is in an excellent location and we enjoyed Toronto very much. However I would not advise anyone to book at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: eightwednesday
Reviews.Content: Without being the one to do the hotel choosing, I avoided reading reviews prior to going (no use getting fixated on the bad when you have no choice in the matter?). However, I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel! Other Radissons I've stayed at have been somewhat disappointing, but not this one. The hotel was completely modern from decor to furnishings and it was CLEAN! I also found the front desk staff to be immensely helpful. Having never been to Toronto before I had a number of questions, from "where is the nearest Future Shop?" (I had forgotten the power supply to my laptop), "how much does the trolley cost?", and the ever awkward "my conference is at a different hotel, directions please?" and they knew their stuff. The location is outstanding! It was within walking distance to tons of great restaurants and bars, not to mention the lake! It was wonderful! Though I probably wouldn't recommend this hotel for couples or a romantic getaway, but if you're traveling through on business, this place gets my vote. The free wi-fi was nothing to scoff at, either.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: darknstormy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as we were attending a concert at the ACC. Great location, friendly staff and huge room. Two queens and a sofa bed. Beds were very comfy and nice pillows, duvets. We got a super rate through Hotwire, but next time will book directly through the hotel so we can make sure we stay here and get a similar room. And next time we will definitely try the in house restaurant. Parking at $21.00/day has to be one of the best hotel rates in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!! Will be staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: daydayday0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Harbourfront for a concert at the Rogers Center. This hotel is the BEST location! But what made our stay so great was the Restaurant Manager Steve Spyrou. When we were checking in he happened to be at the front desk and invited us up to the 5th floor restaurant. Well the service, food and surroundings made for a wonderful evening. Steve made us feel like we were close friends. Truely a ambassdor for the Radisson. Our rooms were lovely and very clean. Check in a breeze. We used the Radisson guarantee on their web site and it worked well. We walked to the Roger's Center and we all had heels on - such a short walk. When we returned from the concert we went to Shoeless Joes (on the main floor) for some wings and drinks. In the morning went back upstairs to have breakfast. Steve met us at the door, remembered our names and asked us about the concert. The breakfast that is included in the room - amazing! Fresh fruit, eggs, toast, cereal, muffins and European fare ie cold cuts, cheese etc.. , bacon, yogurt.....After we ate Steve showed us around the restaurant telling us we really needed to return in the summer. We will! The views of the harbour were spectacular. So for location you can not beat this Hotel! But if you want to really gain it's best benefit meet Steve in the 5th floor restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: nickiford
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night for a Concert at the ACC. The hotel was very clean, great location, easy to find. The rooms were nice and quite modernly decorated. We decided to eat at the adjoining Shoeless Joe's for dinner as opposed to the hotel restaurant as it looked a bit pricey. It was a quick 5 minute walk to the ACC and we felt very safe walking in the area. It would be beautiful in the summer to be able to make use of the roof top pool. We booked right through the hotel website for a very reasonable $107 per night. Parking is not included but was a fairly reasonable $21 per night with in and out privledges underground. On an event day it's very difficult to find parking under $20 without having to walk quite far. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than expected!!”
Reviews.Author: designdrew
Reviews.Content: Went to see a concert at AirCanada Center....so decided to stay somewhere close to the venue. And the location of this hotel was prefect for me!! Its only few mins walk from AirCanada Centre and major metro station. The area is very nice (mix of residential and commercial). I felt very safe during my stay. There are restaurants near by.....and a 24h supermarket just across the street. The hotel staffs were SUPER friendly. As for the room....I think the bed I had was bigger than a king bed!! Very comfortable! The amenity is basic and simple. I would rate "above average" in terms of the cleanness. Overall, its a good hotel, but because of the super friendly staffs....I would rate my experience with this hotel a lot higher!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room.”
Reviews.Author: Gardener01
Reviews.Content: Our room was above average size and furnished well though the 'armoire' style of the HUGE TV cabinet was a little at odds with the minimalist look of the rest of the furnishings. Everything was kept really clean and cosmetic supplies, coffee and bottled water replaced straight away. My other half, a tea drinker, was disappointed to find only creamer in the hospitality pack and so we left a request to the room cleaner for milk. A small covered jug immediately appeared and was replaced daily - a really nice touch. On the negative side - though not a major problem - the location. The harbour side is lovely and our room had a relaxing view over the lake and was very quiet at night. It was however a fairly long trek to the nicer restaurants and so this meant a taxi trip each night. The majority of guests seemed to be mainly businessmen the rather than tourists so I guess, on expenses, they stayed put at night!. As a result of this too, breakfast service seemed rushed (and was expensive, it not being included in the room rate). Perhaps as they tried to get the workers out in plenty of time. No problem though - we found lots of great places for breakfast that suited us far better that were really reasonably priced. Reception staff were not really great. We had to find the facilities rather than them being pointed out to us on arrival, as is usual. We were not told about restaurant opening, fitness centre nor the business centre. No mention of these either in the book in the room. When trying to book car hire, the duty receptionist's poor English skills meant that she just couldn't understand and kept attemting to tell us the exchange rate for cash. It took a good 20 minutes to make the point. This was a bit frustrating and we witnessed a similar problem concerning the same woman and other guests. All told though, the hotel suited our needs and, though more expensive than lots with a more central location, was not a bad choice an certainly had views that more central hotels could not manage.

Reviews.Title: “Service Really Bad”
Reviews.Author: JackB9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and by far one of the most disappointing stays ever at a Hotel in TO and we have stayed at several Hotels in the GTA. Customer service was non-existent. They did not have a cork screw in the room and when we asked for one they said they did not have any. Can you believe a hotel not having a stationary item like that? It was also noisy facing the side of the streetcar tracks. As well the bathroom light was bad. My wife forgot her $200 automatic toothbrush. We called the next day and several days after. The hotel management never got back to us.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: GSS21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Harbourfront for the first three nights of our three week honeymoon in Canada and it was a great start to the holiday. The location was superb - in a quiet part of town only yards from the lake, yet less than a 15 minute walk to the main attractions. First impressions were great, with a newly renovated lobby and very helpful reception staff. The bedroom wasn't quite as modern, but was clean and perfectly ok. The gym facilities were good and pool looked inviting, although we didn't use it. Decent value for money as well, considering standard of accommodation and location. Would definitely recommend the Radisson as a place to stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value”
Reviews.Author: radiohokie
