Reviews.Content: This is a decent pick for a somewhat reasonable hotel in downtown Toronto. There is an underground parking garage as well (very tight quarters) but daily parking is quite expensive. The rooms are not huge but well furnished. The lobby is a bit dated. The staff we encountered was very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “loved the radisson”
Reviews.Author: jockster
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good staff, parking easy. Lobby looks a little tired on way in but our room was fantastic, really quiet at night. located across the road from rodgers centre and cn tower . perfect location, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Msia52
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel. If you are going to the Rogers Centre, this hotel is only two blocks away. Our room, #502, was amazing. It was huge and what a beautiful view of the CN Tower. There was a bit of street noise but it is to be expected in the city. The surrounding area was beautiful, right on the waterfront. There are a couple of decent restaurants right on ground level next to this hotel. My husband parked the van in the garage without a problem. He said the ceiling height was low but not tight. The only draw back is the pool. It is on the fifth floor and open to the public . The hotel charges $35.00 for outsiders to use the pool. It was a young crowd, not teens but 20's. It is a bit of a party atmosphere but my kids enjoyed the pool and the view is stunning over Lake Ontario. I would highly recommend this hotel. One minor thing to note, there are room darkening blinds. You have to look for them behind the other two layers. We found them on checkout. I found the decor to be upscale. Not dark or shabby. I wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location !!!”
Reviews.Author: GCGuy
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved our stay here. The location was great as you are close to Rogers Centre and downtown. It is very convenient to be on the Harbourfront in the summer as there is always something going on in the evenings. The pool was beautiful with a great view of Lake Ontario and Toronto Island Park. All concerns, from some previous reviews, about the pool being a real "party area" and not appropriate for children were not an issue at all. we found it no different than any other outdoor hotel pool. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, front desk not helpful though”
Reviews.Author: The_Car_Is_Packed
Reviews.Content: First, the bad: I thought I'd splurge for me, my wife, and the kids for one night of our driving trip, and get a room with 2 Sleep Number beds while in Toronto. Never tried one, but the commercials are everywhere, so what the heck--only $30-40 more for the room with the upgraded beds. Unfortunately, our room turned out to have standard double beds, and the desk clerk was unable or unwilling to fix it; sadly, when I asked how we could at least have our charges reduced to the standard rate, he said I'd have to take that up with Expedia. Lesson learned! That aside, we did enjoy our room, with a large wall-sized window overlooking the busy street. Unlike some other recent hotels we've stayed at, the Radisson honored our request for a rollaway so our teenaged daughter and son could each have their own bed. Nice room furnishings, clean, quiet. Shower had commendable water pressure, and was capable of scalding water upon request. Parking beneath the hotel was simple enough and included in our stay, though there are some very tight turns on the way into the garage. We loved the feel of the neighborhood, with short walks to CN Tower, Rogers Centre, and lots of lakefront shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottsiegel1959
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto for a Rutgers football game. Radisson was located within walking distance of Roger's Center. Restaurant was being renovated, but there's a nice waterfront seafood next door. Rooms were nice sized and clean.

Reviews.Title: “not bad...”
Reviews.Author: pooley123
Reviews.Content: We attended a social event and the entire group stayed for one night at the Raddison on June 14, 2008. The hotel is in an excellent location if you're interested in exploring the harbour front of Toronto and within walking distance to the CN Tower and the Rogers Centre. Parking at the hotel was a nightmare; first of all it costs 21 dollars to park but that is only if you're lucky enough to get a space. There is no vallet parking and very few of the people in the group were able to get spaces. The decor of the hotel is very dated and extremely worn - I would probably classify this as a 2 star hotel at best, a 3 star - it is definately NOT a 4 star hotel. The rooms were fairly clean and functional but the street below was very noisy and the drapes did not have black-out lining and we were awake at 6 a.m. with the sun pouring into our room. When we booked we confirmed for a king size bed but upon arrival found out that there were no rooms available. Eventually they managed to round-up a room with two double beds only. Our compensation was free parking only. Overall the value is pretty good - the location is amazing but to claim itself to be a 4 star is utterly ridiculous. I'd stay there again but be much more choosey about how much I paid and which room I received.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel and fairly priced”
Reviews.Author: billhobo
Reviews.Content: Visiting for a long weekend, the hotel is located a convenient two blocks from Rogers Centre along the waterfront. The hotel is otherwise relatively close (5-15 minute walk) to other cool spots in town, and had a pretty nice lounge area for relaxing drinks. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at Radisson Harbourfront”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Harbourfront for 5 days at the start of our 3 week Canada tour. We were given a lake view room and enjoyed the fact that it was more relaxed than a hotel that was nearer the centre. Having said that Eaton Centre was 15-20 mins gentle stroll which we found easy. The hotel staff and housekeeping were great. Reception actually organised our Niagara Falls trip which we found out afterwards was more reasonable than other tours - plus we were picked up by a limo much to our surprise! In a nutshell great hotel and very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good, reliable, downtown hotel with easy access to the Gardiner”
Reviews.Author: gordonrink
Reviews.Content: I've been to Toronto about fifteen times in the last year and struggled to find a hotel with easy highway access and a decent gym that does not charge for internet. The Radisson has now become my hotel of choice. The rooms are clean, conditioner is provided along with shampoo, and these are both replaced daily without having to ask. The gym contains a rowing machine, a recumbant bike, a stairmaster, two treadmills, and a weight lifting machine. Pretty standard - what I like most is that for some reason I always seem to get the gym to myself. The bar is quite nice and the bartender is amazing - she makes great drinks and is a great conversationalist. My biggest complaint would be the parking - they recently raised the rates to $21/night which is in line with the more expensive downtown hotels. There are no other parking lots very close to the hotel, so parking in its garage is the best option. Also the access code for internet access sometimes expires before the end of my stay - I suspect this would not happen if I indicated when I was checking out, but I would expect good staff to ask rather than just giving a code that expires the next day. Overall a very reliable hotel with easy access to and from the highways.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Oceanne
Reviews.Content: Based on the many reviews, I chose to stay at the Radisson Admiral while in TO. I could easily reach the hotel arriving from the train station around 11:30pm, which was nice. (15 minutes walking with luggage ;-)). The surroundings: lake and harbor are nice, easy walking distance of the many downtown attractions. Got a CN Tower view room, which was nice as very "TO" :-). Floor to ceiling windows. I haven't tried the breakfast, but I can say that the area where the buffet was dressed is nice and hell (big windows here too - with pool and lake view). As for the room, the bed was very good, which is the most important. Cleaning was fair.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: sdrath
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. We stayed there for three nights in August while we were in town for a wedding. We had read some mixed reviews so we weren't sure what to expect. The rooms were clean and modern and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom wasn't as good --- I'm sure it was a one off but the tub/shower combo's faucet was broken. Some one had twisted it fully around so you could only get warm water never hot. we fixed it ourselves after the second cold shower. The staff were good. We got checkout extended and when I lost a camera case in the lobby it was found an returned to me very quickly. The parking lot is a very tight squeeze...especially if you have a bigger car..some very tight turns.

Reviews.Title: “Lakefront hotel”
Reviews.Author: masi68
Reviews.Content: Radisson Admiral gives you a feeling that it's a rather small hotel and it's centrally located but a short walking distance to the sights and shopping areas. We felt it was really nice to stay somewhere where the busiest traffic didn't hit us as soon we went outside the hotel doors. The first impression was that is was a very quiet hotel, a bit darkish in the hallways. The hotel and rooms are very nice and clean and very spaciuos. The staff are friendly and helpful and we could store our luggage after check-out. The outdoor pool was supposed to be closed in the beginning of September but due to the warm weather it was still open in the end of September. Nearby it's easy to find restaurants, some smaller shops etc. There is a boardwalk next to the piers along the lake.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - location, room, staff”
Reviews.Author: LutonLassie
Reviews.Content: There were a few problems checking in when my name was confused with someone elses, however this was dealt with professionally and I was compensated by not being charged for a late checkout. Staff were very friendly - desk and housekeeping. Room was very comfortable, clean and well airconditioned.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Tubster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the advice of one of our friends who had said the location was good. If you are looking to go to the CN tower, the Rogers centre for a game, a boat trip around the islands, then the location is excellent. We walked from the Rogers centre (5min) to the subway stop (another few minutes ) which can take you more or less anywhere. Staff were very friendly. So friendly in fact, that when we checked in they gave us the keys to someone elses room! Eventually got our own room that had a spectacular view of the CN tower. Room clean, plenty towels, bed comfy, fine . Agree with a previous review about the pool. We were there on a Sunday and myself and 15 y o daughter went up to the pool. We both felt really uncomfortable up there - it was packed with a young crowd, drinking. I must state that there was no shouting or messing about, they were all very well behaved, it was just there were so many of them there was no space. Apart from that, the hotel was extremely quiet in the night, breakfast the next day was very good, and all staff we encountered were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: kat0333
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Radisson was the worst travel decision I have ever made. My boyfriend and I booked in advanced over the phone and were looking forward to a great weekend in Toronto unfortunately staying at the Radisson proved to be stressful. When we arrived we decided to pay for the hotel/park so that we could enjoy the day. First off our vehicle did not fit into the hotel's parking garage. The only solution that the staff gave us was to park a block away for 15$. This did not seem too bad but once we got over to that parking lot we were informed that there was no in and out privledges and we would have to be out of the parking lot by 7am or else we would have to pay another 15$ even if we were leaving at 11am. This was ridiculous and we had all of our belongings in the vehicle. After arguing with the front desk staff we were given a room early so that we would not have to leave all of are valuables in the vehicle a block away. The problems did not end here either. A few days after returning home I was checking my visa bill and sure enough both myself and my boyfriend were both charged for a room at the Radisson. This made no sense at all. I booked the room and needed to give them a visa number to hold the room. Once we arrived my boyfriend gave them his visa to swipe and pay for the room. This was not a problem until we both got charged for rooms. So far the staff and management have not been very helpful. I do not know if this is because we are in our early 20's or if this is the service that they alwasy provide. I would not recomend the Radisson to anyone I know not because of the facility but purely based on the service we received.

Reviews.Title: “O.K - Watch out for outdoor pool ( open to public)”
Reviews.Author: lovelatte
Reviews.Content: Positives - location is o.k Here are the negatives- 1. Outdoor pool OPEN TO public. When we arrived on Sat it was full of 20 year old party people and alcohol was served. 2. The parking is also a lot which is open to public. You have the p3 (third floor) but I don't like parking with same acess as public esp if you have any valuables in car. 3. The ventalation in our room was terrible. There is no fan in washroom and AC blasted on top of you. Some of the washroom smell was ventalated to living room. This might be just our room but bad experience. Overall for price I would not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rhoramsay1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. From the Radisson you have access to the CN towers and not far from the major stuff. Upon entering the hotel tho it is very dark and even tho they had bright colors in the hallways it seem just so dark and blah. I would stay there again but it is not all that......

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Black01
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews before travelling and was a little nervous. I have stayed at many conference hotels before and they are not necessarily what I would choose for a holiday. We were very pleasantly surprised. The location is fantastic. We had a room with a view overlooking the harbour. The room was fully equipped, spacious and clean. So quiet it was lovely. The bed was amazing. My husband had spinal surgery 18 months ago and the bed on holiday makes or breaks our holiday. This was the best we have slept on at a hotel. Far better than the overrated Sheraton sweesleeper. Each side of the bed has adjustments to how hard you want the bed to feel. great toy. The Hotel is ten minutes walk from the CN Tower (Don't miss it, it cured my fear of heights) and fifteen minutes from the entertainment disctrict. Reception staff were efficient but the Concierges were wonderful. they really made our stay special. Small touches like the free mineral water replaced daily meant that you really felt welcome. We walked into the city each day to find breakfast but ate at the hotel on the last day. The food was very good and excellent value and the atmosphere was lovely. The service was attentive but not intrusive. We wished we had eaten there more.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: isabelle23
Reviews.Content: Wow! After reading reviews here I was very hesitant to stay at this hotel but am I ever happy that I did! The rooms were just as they show online and I loved the view! The pool was not open (disappointing but understandable since it has been still quite cold, just happened to be there on a warm day) You can tell that they have recently renovated as everything looks so fresh and clean. The staff were nothing but friendly to me and were happy to bring me extra towels when I asked. The restaurant is glorious overlooking the water and the food was just scrumptious! I really enjoyed having a lounge available in the evening to relax at after a long day of sightseeing. Location was fantastic being by the water and by all of the attractions. We found it quite useful to be able to leave the car parked and to take the trolley right outside of the hotel and to the subway to get us around - good job Toronto on your transit systems! I am going to try to come back again in the summer and I will definitely be staying at the Radisson!!!

Reviews.Title: “was a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: floseimann
Reviews.Content: Just found this website and thought since we stayed there 3,5 years ago i have to wright a review and load up some of my pics !We booked this hotel at a very special rate of about 70$ which was the mainreason for our 2 night stay ! We didnt expected a lot for that rate, but we got a nice room with two queen beds. The room was spacious,clean and very bright because of the large windows.We spent one afternoon at the pool, it was very relaxing there because there were only a few other people, maybe this is the reason for making the pool public as a read in onother review !I would defenetly come back to this hotel and to toronto !!!

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Admiral Toronto Harbourfront
HotelInfo.Address: 249 Queen's Quay West, Toronto, Ontario M5J 2N5, Canada
